title: Tense situation reported outside Moratuwa Police station
byline: A tense situation unfolded outside the Moratuwa Police Station, where over 100 people gathered to protest the arrest of several residents of the area this morning.

title: Prez seeks AG’s intervention to expedite hearing e-passport case
byline: Against the backdrop of the passport crisis worsening by the day, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake instructed the Attorney General to intervene in hearing the court case regarding the e-passport tender floated during the time of the last government in an expeditious manner, a Minister said yesterday.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes ceasefire agreement in Gaza
byline: The Sri Lankan government has welcomed the recent ceasefire agreement in Gaza.

title: Bimal Rathnayake takes train ride, passengers pose questions
byline: A video circulating on social media shows Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake travelling as an ordinary passenger, with commuters raising concerns about various issues affecting the train service.

title: Salaries, allowances of all NPP MPS, Ministers credited to single account: Sunil Watagala
byline: The salaries and allowances of all MPs and Ministers of the NPP government are credited to a single account as in the past, Deputy Minister of Public Security Sunil Watagala said today.

title: China executes man who plowed car into crowds in deadliest attack in a decade
byline: China has executed a man who killed 35 people by plowing his car into crowds at a sports center in November, in the country’s deadliest known attack against the public in a decade, state media reported Monday.

title: Airport vehicle damaged in cracker explosion
byline: A group of officers of the Katunayake International Airport Animal and Bird Control Unit were injured when a firecracker shot into the air to drive away birds, misfired and fell into their vehicle.

title: Arrest warrant issued against former Bangladesh skipper Shakib Al Hasan
byline: A Dhaka court issued an arrest warrant on Sunday against former Bangladesh cricket captain and legendary all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan. The warrant was issued in connection with a cheque bounce case involving approximately $300,000 owed to IFIC Bank. According to reports from Cricbuzz, Dhaka Additional Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Ziadur Rahman issued the warran

title: Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa released on bail
byline: Former Minister Vijith Vijayamuni Soysa, who was arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Unit yesterday, has been granted bail by the Bandarawela Magistrate’s Court.

title: Manusha Nanayakkara to provide statement to CID
byline: Former Minister Manusha Nanayakkara’s legal counsel Saliya Peiris (PC) informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today that his client has agreed to provide a statement to the CID tomorrow regarding the matter related to facilitating job opportunities for Sri Lankans in South Korea.

title: Two Afghan passengers arrested at BIA
byline: Two Afghanistan passengers who attempted to enter the country on forged passports were arrested early this morning by the Immigration and Emigration officers at the Katunayake International Airport.

title: Over 3,000 dengue cases in 20 days
byline: The tally of dengue cases recorded for 2025 has topped the 3,000 mark, according to the Epidemiology Unit.

title: Discussion to consider possibility of reducing fuel prices soon: President
byline: Claiming that reducing fuel prices will take some time, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said at a meeting that discussions will be held with relevant parties to consider the possibility of reducing fuel prices soon.

title: UNP, SJB talks to begin today
byline: The talks between the United National Party (UNP) and the Sagami Jana Balawegaya (SJB) aimed at forming a broad right wing alliance is to begin in the evening today, SJB MP Mujibur Rahman said.

title: Government conspiring to evict MR from his residence: Dolawatte
byline: The government is conspiring to evict former President Mahinda Rajapaksa from his residence, former MP Premanath C. Dolawatte said today.

title: Media outcry including DM report prompts psychiatrist to accept transfer
byline: The psychiatrist who was reported to have given false reasons to avoid posting to District General Hospital in Mullaitivu has accepted her transfer and begun her duties following significant media outcry including the Daily Mirror report on January 15 and also as a result of the public scrutiny over her initial reluctance to take up the post.

title: Flash floods affect close to 17,000
byline: A total of 16,930 persons from 5,738 families have been affected across eleven districts due to natural disasters such as flash floods, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Tilvin stresses need to win LG polls
byline: The Janatha Vimukthi Peramuna (JVP) General Secretary Tilvin Silva stressed the need to win the Local Government election to be held in April this year if the programme initiated by the government is to be taken forward.

title: First Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners freed in ceasefire deal with Hamas
byline: Around 90 Palestinian prisoners and detainees were freed from Israeli jails and into the occupied West Bank on Sunday, as part of an exchange under ceasefire deal between Hamas and Israel that went into effect Sunday morning. Their release comes hours after three Israeli women were set free by Hamas-led Palestinian militants who held them hostage in Gaza for 471 days.

title: DM exposure on stinking Beira alerts authorities; cleaning begins but ceases halfway
byline: An instant cleaning process that kicked off on Friday at the stinking tourist hot spot of Colombo’s Beira Lake following a Dailymirror exposure about the lake’s abominable condition near Gangarama Seema Malaka has been seized halfway with the stench and garbage still remaining in vital corners.

title: Pay rent of Rs. 4.6 mn or vacate residence: AKD tells MR
byline: The rent for the residence of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa was valuated as Rs. 4.6 million per month and he could either pay the rent or leave the residence, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.
